name: GetAvailableTemplates
description:
Retrieve a list of available email templates.

Fetches and returns a list of all the email templates available in a Mailchimp account. Useful for managing and selecting templates for campaigns.

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response, using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields_list
parameters.description: Comma-separated fields to exclude from the response, using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: number_of_records_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of template records to return (1-1000). Default is 10.

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0. Use for paginated responses.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: template_creator_user
parameters.description: Specify the Mailchimp account user who created the template to filter results.

value_schema.description: The Mailchimp account user who created the template.

parameters.name: created_after_date
parameters.description: Retrieve templates created after a specific date. Use ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00).

value_schema.description: Restrict the response to templates created after the set date. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: restrict_before_date_created
parameters.description: Restrict the response to templates created before the specified date in ISO 8601 format. For example: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

value_schema.description: Restrict the response to templates created before the set date. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: template_type
parameters.description: Specify the template type to limit the results. This filters the email templates based on their type.

value_schema.description: Limit results based on template type.

parameters.name: filter_by_category
parameters.description: Limit the results to templates that match a specific category.

value_schema.description: Limit results based on category.

parameters.name: template_folder_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the folder containing templates to retrieve.

value_schema.description: The unique folder id.

parameters.name: sort_templates_by_field
parameters.description: Specify the field to sort templates by. Determines the sorting order of returned templates.

value_schema.description: Returns user templates sorted by the specified field.

parameters.name: template_content_type
parameters.description: Filter templates based on content structure. Use 'template' for legacy, 'multichannel' for new editor, or 'html' for code your own.

value_schema.description: Limit results based on how the template's content is put together. Only templates of type `user` can be filtered by `content_type`. If you want to retrieve saved templates created with the legacy email editor, then filter `content_type` to `template`. If you'd rather pull your saved templates for the new editor, filter to `multichannel`. For code your own templates, filter to `html`.

parameters.name: sort_order_direction
parameters.description: Specify the order direction for sorted results ('asc' for ascending, 'desc' for descending).

value_schema.description: Determines the order direction for sorted results.
